doc:
Otto Lederer https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Otto_Lederer 0 Otto Lederer (April 17, 1886 – September 3, 1965) was an Austria-Hungary-born American film actor. He appeared in 120 films between 1912 and 1933, most notably The Jazz Singer, the first full-length film to have sound sequences, and the Laurel and Hardy short You're Darn Tootin'. He was born in Prague, and died in Woodland Hills, Los Angeles. He was married to actress Gretchen Lederer. Otto was entombed in Glendale's Forest Lawn Memorial Park Cemetery. Otto_Lederer ( April_17_,_1886 – September_3_,_1965 ) was an_Austria-Hungary-born_American_film_actor . He appeared in 120_films between 1912_and_1933 , most_notably The_Jazz_Singer , the_first_full-length_film to_have sound_sequences , and the_Laurel_and_Hardy_short You 're_Darn_Tootin ' . He was_born in Prague , and died in Woodland_Hills , Los_Angeles . He was_married to actress_Gretchen_Lederer . Otto was_entombed in Glendale 's_Forest_Lawn_Memorial_Park_Cemetery .
